reviews.text: Excellent location. Clean, modern, large, warm, comfortable room. Powerful hot shower and decent quality towels. Unbeatable value for money.
reviews.title: Unbeatable value for money

reviews.text: We booked this hotel to stay in London over the new year period to see the firework displays at London Eye.
reviews.title: Average nor good or bad

likes.liked: — Frequent, fast and comfortable train link to central London

reviews.text: I splited up the booking into three separate ones, as I wanted to purchase an evening meal for new years eve (since I thought it will be may expensive to eat in a restaurant as they may let you dine from a set menu). However, I got an eMail on 19. of December that they are sorry but "due to the low demand" they've removed evening meals for new years eve and some three other days in the period. It was not a problem because I managed to dine somewhere else, but found that policy a bit frustrating even I wonder because these are normally busy dates.
reviews.title: Better than you'd think

likes.liked: — Lots of conveniences nearby: shops, restaurants, news agents...
likes.disliked: — Entrance from the street is a bit unwelcoming, but how long will you be there?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of Croydon nearby the Home Office and right opposite the Whitgift shopping centre which has a nic Alders’ department store and a small Sainsbury's Central where you can get groceries or water. Croydon Tramlink's Wellesley Road stop is directly adjusted to the hotel, but do not try to cheat and take a tram from East Croydon railway station as it will take you round the Croydon circle before calling at the hotel and it's only a short walk from the station. However, towards the station it's maybe nice to take the tram.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: As this was the first time I booked a Travelodge I haven't known what I have to expect. I was really surprised overall how convenient it was for the price of 19 pound, as I managed to get a saver rate.
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.text: Stayed here for a third time in the last week of August 2007.
reviews.title: Not a good stay for such a new Travelodge.

reviews.text: What a huge difference and, unfortunately, not such a good experience this time.
reviews.title: Highs and lows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Start at the beginning.
reviews.title: Inexpensive For London, But That Is It

reviews.text: Parking. There is NO parking under or next to the hotel. There are two disabled bays, which we can use, but you have to be very quick to secure either. On no account should you even risk parking in the other spaces as you WILL get clamped and it will cost you £190 for it to be released. There is a NCP car park nearby but if you're touring and have a top box or a particularly tall car then you won't fit in.
reviews.title: A cheap room but poor service and incapable and unhelpful staff

likes.liked: — Cheap deal, and very convenient for London

reviews.text: Entry. Through the ground floor and into a corridor that doubles up as the linen store. There are two lifts, both of which now have mirrors missing, to take guests to the first floor (second floor in the US) reception area. None of the staff on reception were native English speakers which normally isn't a problem for us but the young lady had a strong Eastern European accent that we struggled to understand sometimes.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerful if you get the discounted rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late at night and was greeted by a lovely reception staff member. However it went down hill after this I know its a no frills hotel however we booked a double room for 2 people but was given just one towel there is a sign in the bathroom stating that the water can not be drinken therefore you have to buy drinks and bring back to the hotel with you as the costs were rather expensive. We only paid £19 for the room as we booked so far in advance so I cant really complain however these rooms usually go for £50 a night and its 100% not worth that kind of money. Will most defintley never stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having used Travelodges before and after reading the reviews we knew what to expect. We parked at the Whitgift shopping centre car park before making the short walk to the Hotel. Yes the entrance to the building is not very welcoming plus one of the lifts was out of order the weekend we stayed. The remaining lift was the fastest I've come across in an hotel plus it only allows you access to your own floor. Once up to the reception on the first floor we were checked in by a pleasant and helpful member of staff. Our bedroom was very large with no frills. It was very clean on arrival and the housekeeping staff kept it so during our stay. The bathroom was small and functional. Strange that the bedroom had only one chair provided.
reviews.title: A practical choice for visit to London
tap water not for drinking!
reviews.text: The location is very good with the rail station a short walk away with its fast and frequent service into London. On the first night we ate at the Miso Noodle Bar close to the station. Lovely staff and not at all expensive.
Overall a very good choice for anyone on a budget that wants to visit London.
reviews.title: Superb value

likes.disliked: — For the price we paid I have no complaints whatsoever.

reviews.text: Our tour bus arrived at the back entrance. Greeting us was piles of loose garbage bags, stacked 7-8 ft high.
reviews.title: Awful Experience
